content:
Posted: September 9, 2014
												This is one of the best star wars games made hands down.One the graphics look like great even for a xbox orginal game, I would say if I didnt play this as a kid that it was a early xbox 360 game.Second it's AI is very smart for its age, and you have to work with you 're team.Otherwise you 're dead easy.Third the story is very good never a dull moment. Wide varity of combat zones that give options to do in every fire fight, sending squad to snipe, use gun placements,anti armour,med stations which you will need and other tactical advantages and objectives. The game does not feel like a normal "Star Wars game" as in it forces you to think tactical and punishes you for not doing so.That all beig said Starwars Republic Comando is a great game for starwars fans young, old and new. It is a 10/10 in my book even years later.

content:
Posted: September 27, 2015
												A squad based FPS set in the Star Wars universe with you taking on the roll of RC-1138 aka Boss. It's split up into 3 arcs and spawned a 4 part book series that's rather enthralling and I highly recommend as much as this game. It's a game that took on a really unique way of doing things that makes it hard for you to 1 man army and your squad is highly effective if given the right orders. It was designed with a controller in mind but forces KB/M which, when gotten used to, can function quite well. It's also got a really great music score and memorable characters.

content:
Posted: January 2
												I absolutely love this game! It shows how awesome the Clone Commandos are and is great because there are absolutely no Jedi! I'd like to say real quickly that if you want this game and are leery because it says 'blood and gore,' don't be worried. There is a little blood, but not much (most of it is green alien blood); and the 'gore' is nothing to worry about. There is also just a bit of language as well. The campaigns are great! I love the weaponry options in the game, and the commands you give the Commandos are easy to use and understand. For being an 11-year-old game, IT IS FREAKIN' AWESOME! Last note about the game: The multiplayer does not work because the company that hosts the server shut down a few years ago.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 21, 2014
												Star Wars Republic Commando is a Squad-Based FPS. that means you can't "Rambo" through this game. The single player puts you in the boots of the leader of Delta Squad, a squad of Clone Commandoes. You can tell your squad waht to do... YES. The Single player is difficult (Like most 6th gen FPS's) and can get FRUSTRATING at times. when you die you dont go back to your last save like most FPS's, when you die, you have to wait till your squad can revive you, you will go back to your last checkpoint if you whole squad dies. you are responsible for the lives of your squad mates, that means when bacta despensers are around, you need to tell your troops to "Stop loafing around, and get some bacta". the campaign is nice and long, unlike Call Of Duty's 4 hour campaign. The weapons are good, you start with a Pistol, that does jack♥♥♥♥♥♥in terms of damage, then you have the Blaser rifle, that the standard full auto rifle. then there the sniper rifle that is good, i guess. the anti-armor thingy is AWESOME, high damage, can DESTROY groups of enemys. then we have alien guns, the ACP is a trandoshan smg, nothing special, the array gun is this games shotgun. my favorite gun! and the trandoshan minigun and railgun are AMAZING guns as well! 2 wookie guns, bowcaster and the wookie rocket luancher. Now about that ending... UHG... The ending SUCKS. (SPOILERS) so, you destroy a ship, you have to leave behinde delta 08, and yoda says, "The battle has begun" and you say 'Lock and load deltas!". Credits, WTF. The multiplayer feels like a lackluster Halo clone, not that fun. And the servers are closed do to the GameSpy shutdown. i recommend this game on its single player, and i would love to see a Republic Commando II. 8/10

												I think this game is AWESOME for any age! if you do not want your kids playing halo, cod,ETC. this game is PERFECT!very easy to learn for people who have played pc games before.this game is a EXTREMELY good fps game! great graphics(for a game that came out 10 years ago but still really good!)decent AI and best of all......BEATING THE TAR OUT OF STUFF WITH YOUR GUNS.ok enough with that lets get back to age...yes there is a good amount of blood  BUT this only happens when you kill them close or melee style (knife or hitting em with your pistol,BUT the blood is SOOOOO unrealilistic! its blue purple and orange but its goes on your helment but your helment cleans it very fast.BUT i am not saying let very little kids play this game, it might lead them to asking you if they can get halo gta cod, even though this game is WAYYYYYY below those games  graphic/inapproiote nis. in this game you DO NOT kill PEOPLE you kill droids and geonisions(alien things)this game is very fun and all ages can play and you gamers out there who like M rated games more then games like this this one is still a MUST BUY it is for adults and kids but kinda for 10-11 i think because it looks eye to eye on kids who are going through the stage when they cant play M rated games and dont want to play lego games.If you like shooters and you like star wars and you likes first person shooters this is a MUST BUY if you like first person shooters this game is a MUST BUY if you like video games this a MUST BUY because it puts EVERY SINGLE ELMENT of a video game into this one!all in all,buy this ten dollar game and i GURANTEE you will think it was the best ten dollars you have ever spent! thank you for your time of reading this review and click on the helpful icon below if this helped you!

content:
Posted: December 27, 2014
												NOTE: These are my views of the game, not generally a review, but may help.What can be said about Star Wars: Republic Commando that hasn't already been said? It's just simply awesome, it may be a game from 2005 but it is a game that is as ageless as it is priceless. My playing hours on this has only recorded a fraction of the time I played as I got it previously a couple of years ago off Steam and played through it and then again offline after I got it here.I'm a fan of the novels, and this just brings the characters you meet there, namely Delta Squad, to life. 11/10 for sure. Though I speak from a fans perspective, I also say this because the game has great dialogue, iconic characters, and a great amount of action and story that made a mark on the hearts of everyone who played this. A great game.

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 15, 2015
												Despite being extremely dated and naturally having trouble with modern machines, this game is perhaps one of the greatest Star Wars games. It has a narrow focus, features no Jedi, depicts a highly professional and futuristic space marine unit before it was cool, has a psychotic version of Kaidan Alenko, a short but sweet story, and allows you to blast many a clanker and gearhead on the backdrop of excellent remixes of The Droid Invasion and Palaptine's Theme, or the occasional Mandalorian battle chant, written before they became Karen Traviss's pets.And, luckily, Delta Squad survives the recent "canon reset".

content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
												Pay no attention to the year of release, this game holds up remarkably well.  A single player squad based shooter that is also very fast paced is a rare find, and the game play is definitely fun.  You get to issue commands to 3 AI teammates who can hold their own quite well.  The banter is also pretty entertaining to listen to. Also, very rarely will you see your companions do stupid things.  We all know games where ai is more a hindrance then a benefit, and this is not one of those by any means.  You could just ignore squad commands most of the time, but telling a member to hole up in a sniper position will make them very much more effective.It's a great game, that just happens to take place in the star wars universe.  Which is a very, very good thing if your a fan. If you are a fan of star wars don't even hesitate as this game is well worth your time.  If you don't care much for the franchise the game play is still very much worth a playthrough.  I highly recommend this game!

content:
Posted: December 31, 2016
												Now before someone tears my head off for giving a negative review let me explain...I only recently played the game and so I have no nostalgia factor for this review at all but I have heard quite a few good things about it so I was excited when I saw it on the christmas sale.Pros:+StarWars+Team AI is for the most part competent+Soundtrack+Good Characters+Team Banter+Visor Effects (Blood and NightVision)Other:+/- Decent Gameplay-Mouse sensitivity in the menus is crazy but is okay in-game+Older game that works without jumping through hoops for Windows 10Cons:-Extremely short campaign 3 main missions that take roughly two hours a piece on the medium difficulty-Not really a unique story it's just you leading delta through three different missions with no plot to speak of-Ends abruptly after a BS cliffhanger-Only makes use of three different environments (Geonosis, Acclamator, Kashyyk)-Lack of variety in every way-No replay value-Graphics are downright ugly in some areas (Clones Especially look terrible)-The multiplayer has been shutdown-Hasn't aged wellOverall:Republic Commando feels like a concept that wasn't fully realized in this game. Throughout my playthrough I kept waiting hoping for that awesome moment that honestly never really came. It's not that the game is bad it's just that it feels kinda meh by the time you finish it which is really disappointing to me for a game I heard so much about. If you're into star wars you'll enjoy the game there's no doubt about that but if you haven't played some of the other games like kotor or the jedi knight series those games give you more for your money.TLDR; 5/10 Average game with a short shelf life dwarfed by similar titles like rainbow six or other starwars games.

content:
Posted: May 11, 2014
												Republic Commando has one of the greatest plots of all the Star Wars games, I even dare to say it comes close to the Jedi Knight games.You play as Clone Commando 39, which everyone calls Boss but because of the role he plays in the story i call him Player, you have three AI buddies, 7 or sev, 40 or fixer and 62 or Scorch.One thing that i wish this game had was 4 player co-op because at times the AI feels a little dumb, especially on the core ship on geonosis and the acclameter cruser Prosecutor which you have a time limit, yes an actual time limit after which the whole squad dies.The guns are interesting, you have a pistol similar to the blaster in Quake 2 and 4 with few differences, instead of charging up the pistol for more damage and having unlimited ammo the pistol has a small charge which recharges even while the pistol is holstered, your DC-17 blaster which has two other attachments, sniper and anti armour. Enemies don't drop ammo for your main weapons so you must rely on ammo pickups scattered throughout the levels, although each ammo pickup completely fills your ammo for the gun it's designed for.In addition to your DC-17 blaster rifle and DC-15 blaster pistol you can carry one extra weapon which is especially useful when they introduce Trandoshans because you can use their weapons, these weapons are the beam weapons that the Geonosian Elites use, a wookie bowcaster which charges up like the bowcaster in the Jedi Knight games only instead of firing like a shotgun it fires a stronger shot, also you can reload it, although this isn't the only wookie weapon because this time arround they have a rocket launcher too. Trandos have three weapons that you can use: a repeater, a heavy repeater and for the first time in a star-wars game, an actual shotgun.Enemies are fun to take down especially the Super Battle Droids, Droidekas and Dwarf Spider Droids. Magna Gaurds are also make an appearance, but aswell as their electro-stalf they have two dumbfire missiles, and so do the DSDS that appear in Republic Commando.There are squad actions scattered throughout the level, from the generic door breaches to the odd objective, although there are places that you can order your AI buddies to set up and these are the only time they change their weapons.Aswell as all these guns you also have four grenade types: aswell as the the standard thermal detonators we've been using since the early Dark Forces/Jedi Knight games you have a stun grenade, an EMP grenade and a sticky prox mine although watch where you place them because they have a wide detection range and they will explode if anything gets too close, even you or your squaddies, like your weapons EMP grenades, stun grenades and sticky bombs don't get dropped by enemies but thermal detonators do, although these only give you about 3 TDs.Multiplayer is UT with a Star-Wars twist with a tiny bit of Halo (unfortunitly) there are four gamemodes, Deatmatch, TDM, CTF and Assault which are pretty much identical to their UT counterparts, unlike in UT and main the campaign you can only carry two guns, but you start off with the DC-15 pistol and DC-17 blaster.In general if you get this game you should only get it for the campaign because while UT is a good game that kind of multiplayer just doesn't fit here.

number of helpful: 0 of 10 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 1, 2015
												"Let's be like Halo" said every first person shooter developer of the early 2000's. Recharging shields protecting a non-recharging health meter, all weapons are fired from the hip with no form of aiming besides a centralized targetting reticle, got your melee attack that's always at the ready, easy-to-use grenades that are always at the ready, linear paths to objectives that take you through numerous firefights along the way, and you watch all of this from behind a combat visor.Fortunately for Republic Commando, I love Halo. Plus, RC tends to add some nifty features to the mix, such as the tactical aspect of commanding your squad (although the main tactic seems to be "tell squad to snipe, step away from keyboard"). It also does a pretty good job of giving the characters personalities. They seem real, as opposed to just monotonous drones like Halo marines. Well worth the cheap price, and if you want to play multiplayer even now that GameSpy is dead, you can get GameRanger.

content:
Posted: May 24, 2016
												This game was amazing back in the day. It's pretty much unplayable, now. Like many others, I've installed a few fixes from other players, but it's still glitchy. The cursor in the menu moves 1/4 of the screen when the mouse moves 1/16th of an inch on the lowest DPI setting. In game, the cursor is much slower, but it's "jumpy" (for lack of a better word) to where the game started giving me a headache after only 5-10 minutes.Some have said it's modern hardware plaguing the game, but I've played FarCry and a few others from the same or older time period without any of this craziness.Would I recommend Republic Commando? YES. Fantastic game.Would I recommend Republic Commando as sold on Steam? NO. Not unless you are willing to really sink time into getting it to work.By the way, I had to play the game in windowed mode, because every time I tried full screen, the game crashed. Personally, I'm going to put more time into making it work because I know it's an amazing game, but I would NOT recommend this to just any casual gamer due to the glitches.

												This game looks terrific from their steam page but three problems are left out. 1) Game Length - This game is very short for a single player shooter. It is about 6 hours and features "four" locations. Kamino is a intro cutscene, Geonosis, An abandoned Reublic Starship and Kashyyyk (Home of the Wookies). This game features no multiplayer so it is really short.2) Story - It is boring, the characters are generic clones, I can't remember if the game had a plot but i am pretty sure you are just sent on three different missions and thats it. 3) Gameplay/Shooting - For a 6 Hour Campaign  this game is boring gameplay wise aswell. Their are a lack of enemy types and guns to choose from. I do NOT understand why this game gets so much praise. If you want a bland Star Wars Shooter go play EA and DICE's Star Wars Battlefront, at least that game also looks good.

number of helpful: 2 of 20 people (10%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 10, 2016
												This game can be fun at times, but several of the game-mechanics are just outrageous, and they are bad enough to ruin the game experience for me. Fair enough, it is an old game and the people who bought this game when it came out probably had a lot of fun with it. But for someone who are adapted to the modern game marked and has a higher standard for game-quality, I would not recommend this. The graphics are what you can expect from the time it was made and it runs fairly decent. But again, some of the game-mechanics are in dire need of tuning and it suffers from a quite common problem with certain levels being just ridiculously hard to complete. You as a player are constantly being stacked against near impossible odds (which is of course where some of the charm of the game comes from), and there is a notable lack of creative solutions to solve a situation. Outrageous game-mechanics, unnecessary hard levels and a general lack of creativity: these issues alone are what caused me to create this review.However, if you are a Star Wars fan, this game does feature some quite interesting elements. The story is something for itself and you get a more personal look at some of the overlooked elements in the Star Wars universe.

content:
Posted: May 19, 2016
												Pros:-good soundtrack-short-action packed-challengingCons:-short (6-7 hours)-all 3 levels are the same-repetitous gameplay-unsatisfying gunplay-shallow gameplay-extremely annoying enemy typesConclusion:  I really wanted to like Republic Commando as it was one of the games from when I was a kid that I saw in a magazine but never got to play.  Unfortunately, it's a rather weak fps with squad mechanics.  The environments are bland, ALL of the guns feel weak, and the gameplay was extremely repititous throughout the 3 levels.  The only place where the devs changed it up was by throwing in a turret section at the very end.  The guns felt so weak that I ended up just melee attacking every enemy.  There are 5-6 enemy types and some get very frustrating to fight near the end.  There were some redeeming factors such as how they took the visor/helmet mechanics from Metroid Prime (fog, blood dripping down the front, etc).  Overall the campaign was extremely short and unsatisfying and because the official multiplayer is down, I can't factor that in to my opinion of this title.     5.5/10

content:
Posted: January 4, 2016
												I have not completed the single player part of the game yet, but from what i have seen up now, it is a linear shooter with fairly simple objectives, extremely repetitive as it is go shoot this and that, investigate this or that while shooting these enemies and those enemies, every 10 meters there is at least a healing point or three depending on the amount of enemies and how hard your squad is hit. considering the year it was made, the graphics are pretty good and some low res textures in some places. the polygon models for a number of the races seen, especially the noisy carpets on that forest planet of theirs could of done with a going over once more.Would i recommend this? not really due to how repetitive the game is. if it had some form additional change of pace or puzzles or something like that, it could potentially be a little better. This is right up there with the original Farcry, you can try play stealthy, but in reality you are better off just blundering into yet another fight where stealth means little.Would of thought such a technologically advanced faction would of had the idea to build some silencers and scopes you can use for head shots. anyway, there is actually nothing wrong with the game for the most part, it is just as stated, a bit repetitive.Edit: After completing the single player part, the story was left hanging after what happened at the end, so it somewhat feels only half complete.

number of helpful: 6 of 42 people (14%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 15, 2016
												Just like with Call of Duty; World at War, every time I tried to play this damn game something happens and I’m unable to. Either computers blowing up or me lacking the interest to go through with it, I always stop. Well, I got this game on a gigantic Star Wars pack a good time ago and I finally went through it, to finally see what it has to offer. And as usual, I’m gonna talk first about what it does worst, then move up from there.First and foremost, the story. They had a perfect opportunity to fill parts the movies didn’t really show about these damn iconic troopers. And what did they do? Waste it. Sure, you get to fight on the Geonosis raid on the first stage, but you never get to see anything else from the movies, no Samuel L. Mace Windu Jackson decapitating mandalorians or anything. And up from there, it’s just a few set pieces that are quite disappointing. I MEAN COME ON, I WAS SERIOUSLY HOPING TO GET TO SHOOT OBI WAN AFTER THE ORDER 66, BUT THE GAME NEVER GOES ANYWHERE! Second, the weapons are… Meh. The initial idea is actually quite f#cking interesting, a swiss-knife kind of deal, your weird gun is actually a ton of different kinds of guns. I liked that! However it barely does anything original with that, the guns are the most uninspired cr#p you can think: generic spamming rifle, generic 1-headshot-kill sniper rifle, generic OP-Grenade launcher… And the worst part is that you can pick alien weapons and add them to your arsenal, which sounds cool until you notice how BAD they are at everything! I WAS HOPING SO MUCH THAT THE SHOTGUN COULD MAKE THE GAME FUN, BUT IT’S JUST THE WORST AGAINST DROIDS! AT POINT-BLANK RANGE! YOU DO MORE DAMAGE BY PUNCHING THEM!Third, the squad mechanics. I personally think this game was ahead of it’s time on a bad way, this game SERIOUSLY NEEDED COOP. If it had, you would have Star Wars Left 4 Dead. However with just single player and a dead multiplayer mode (that kinda sucked anyway), it’s not so fun because their AI is as dead as progress with Half-Life 3. Giving them orders is cool at first, then you’ll notice how it never brings much new from what you see on the first 10 minutes of the game. It also doesn’t help that they’re stupid.The PC version is also a weird port made in the deepest areas of hell. Some of the stuff the devs thought were okay for PCs make me want to look for them and shove my computer up their #ss.Lastly, the stages themselves. I’ve already said that there’s not much to the story, right? Well, the stages are also quite small. And when I say small, I really mean small. What engine does this game use? Did they really have so many limitations? Every 2-4 minutes there’s another loading screen, and those 2-4 minutes were mostly just struggling to advance a large corridor. The game also barely has different themes going for it. There’s the initial Geonosis level. There’s an abandoned ship in space. There’s the Wookie planet. Another ship. And that’s it.So, does the game actually have good stuff going for itself? Kinda. At times…The characters themselves on your squad are not so bad. Sure they’re clichéd as all hell but I rather have 4 clichéd well written characters than a billion bad ones (LOOKING AT YOU, JAR JAR). Also the squad mechanics are cool when they’re first shown.The music and sound department is quite good, truly feels like taking out from Attack of the Clones, which helps feel better about the rest of the poor game.The enemies are also quite nice. They never truly feel broken, and are actually entertaining to fight against… Excluding the classic moments when HORDES OF UNLIMITED DROIDS ARE SWARMING YOU AND THERE’S LITERALLY NOWHERE TO HIDE FROM THAT CR#P.Personally, this is disappointing. No wonder there was never a sequel, it doesn’t feel properly finished. Do I recommend it? Save yourself the disappointment, and ignore it. I don’t really think it’s worth paying money for this. I was happier thinking that back then I was just half-way through the game and it actually could get interesting, playing through it to the end today made me see that I was 2 loading screens away from a really disappointing ending. TL;DR Edition: A great idea gone down to hell and back thanks to both a bad PC port and feeling empty and unfinished. The story is short and will make you feel like committing space-sudoku. If you don’t get it for free, I can’t really recommend this. Coop could’ve saved the game, sadly it’s mainly single player with a dead multiplayer option.

content:
Posted: June 29, 2015
												This reviews probably won't count for alot of people because I'm personally not much of a Star Wars fan.The game had interesting conscepts and I never played it when it was first released way back when so I think I missed out when this game was top of the line.The sound in this game is pretty badass, the music is great and the dialog between your squadmates is cleaver in giving them well rounded personalities.The graphics vary throughout the game in my opinion, the first are you start in looked like crap to me with terrible textures and bland empty areas, but when you're inside of ships or helping out the wookies there's more design put into the levels it seems so it actually gets better thoughout the game.The AI annoyed the hell out of me, you need to tell them to do every little thing, if you leave them alone during a fight for even a few seconds they'll find the worst cover possible like under a turret or in the line of fire of a super battle droid and get utterly destroyed. This ends up being a chain reaction sometimes since you other squadmates will then run to the downed person and try to revive them getting shredded by the same damage that started the problem in the first place. They continuously walked in front of my fire, a few times they walked in front of me just as I was tossing a grenade so it bounced back and took most of my health.The guns are probably the worst part for me, you get a pistol, assault rifle, sniper, anti armor rocket, and a special weapon. But the reticles for them are just horrible. The assault rifle is the worst just being a huge circle that you fire pretty much on the right side of. The ammo caps for the weapons are really low too, making it so you spend some of the game swimming in ammo you can't even pick up, and then other parts in the game completely tapped out for long stretches of time (Except for the worst gun for the situation like the energy shotgun special weapon in a long range encounter). There isn't that many enemy types, just bugs, droids, and lizards. The main issue is that droids like the droidika and the super battle droid are largely bullet sponges, which in itself wouldn't be bad in order to toss a little bit of a need to focus fire in the mix, but towards the end of the game they send droves of super battle droids at you, and given how much ammo you waste on them I actually found it easier to just grenade them as a distraction then circle strafe around them and melee them to death (A ridiculous tactic that really breaks the seriousness of everything but it saves on ammo and actually resulted in me getting shot less).Pros:Great soundtrackSquad dialog is pretty entertainingWookies (They're huge and pretty viscious but they tend to just run into fire and die)Cons:Graphics are datedAIGunsWaves of bullet sponge enemies as you go furtherBuggy (Tell squadmates to take up snipe positions and watch them target things out of their line of site, or not switch to the sniper and proceed to try and hit long range targets with terrible accruacy weapons. Had a few get stuck in some place and stop following me.)I doubt they changed much since this game came out so if you liked it then you'd like it now. I just wasn't the correct audience for this particular game and it got pretty dull towards the end.

number of helpful: 11 of 59 people (19%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 30, 2015
												If you are one of the people who are considering buying this game because of positive comments you've read online and are not a Star Wars fanboy... then read on.(Actually I was a real big fan of Star Wars when I was a kid. I think Dark Forces (1994) is more fun than this game)I bought this after reading all the "Best FPS ever" comments.The Steam version wouldn't load on my computer and after logging in to GOG I saw similar comments; "Best FPS..." blah blah so I paid 10 bucks for it and downloaded the Graphics Mod to enable 16:9 ratio and fix a lot of bugs. Took the warning about mouse-speed to heart. Read about the Full-screen anti-aliasing crashes the game and set the resolution to 4K instead of using FSAA. Read about the compatibility issues and inability to use EAX. Proceeded to open the game. And it actually loaded.Played for a while, and immediately got the feeling of a generic, dated FPS set in a Lucas Arts / Star Wars Universe... far away in some Hollywood Studio in the 2000s.Gameplay is excruciatingly simple. The enemy droids miss 90% of the time. Gameplay is strictly linear, running along narrow corridors and areas. One direction, no alternatives as far as I could see. (Played 2 hours on GOG version)And then there is the "amazing" tactics that everyone whimpers about. Well the "amazing" in this game consists of one button .. no I'm serious. There is a Use Button. If you want to blow up something blocking your way, (you'll know if you can because a big icon will appear on the object) you aim at it and press Use. The 'demolitions' expert automatically jumps forward and starts doing his stuff.You want to 'heal' your team-mate? No problem. Aim at a health 'bacta' tank thing and press, you guess it! USE.The game so far is beyond monotony. I'm glad I got it to play in 4K at 16:9 with bump-mapping because I'd have been angrier about this "Best FPS ever" (rolls eyes) if I had to play it as is available with the default installer: forced 4:3 ratio. A choice of resolutions I haven't remembered since DOOM 2 and QUAKE. i.e. 640x480, 800x600, 1024x768. Crashes. Glitches.*sigh*End opinion? This is definitely, by far, NOT the best FPS ever.You can pick up a really good game for the price of this. Games like Insurgency, or heck.. even Crysis was on sale for a couple bucks and that game is a much better game than this rubbish.

number of helpful: 3 of 40 people (8%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 22, 2015
												A game that I loved as a teenager, but just feels dated today. It's an early example of what "console port" used to mean - sloppy controls, low-skill gunplay, linear environments, bland appearance. Remember, this game came out in 2005, a year after Half-life 2, and contemporary with Battlefield 2, and CoD 2.But what really stuck in my young mind was the teamplay, the ability to order three commandos around and manuever into (and out of) sticky situations. My distant memory had been very positive, on par with Brothers in Arms or Ghost Recon. Sadly, that isn't really the case. The commands you can give are limited by the environment - you can say "use that turret" or "take cover there", but are otherwise unable to command your people. More often than not trying to get them to "hold that area" will result in them standing with no cover, clustered on a single point. The levels are the definition of linear gameplay, with absolutely no deviation from the script available.I feel bad giving this a negative review from a modern perspective. The game was actually rather daring for it's age, and deserved the praise it received. But I'm not reviewing it in 2005, it's ten years later and the game simply hasn't held up, and i wouldn't recommend it as a way to spend time.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2015
												So when I was a Senior in High School I had a friend absolutely raving about this game. Now a decade later I finally play the game. I'll let the graphics slide because it's based on what the Xbox 1 could handle at the time. That being said Halo looked better. Second off everything about the gameplay is terrible. Just terrible. It's based on setting up bombs, waiting, then blowing it up. Rinse and repeat. Gunplay you unload 1k bullets on the thing and it finally blows up. Most of the time I just stood in place shooting at stuff. It feels like the hit detection is off and hit chance on you is a system of RNG. The story is sorta neat but it follows a story that really is made for 8yr old kids and is really not crucial because it's based on behind the scenes of Lucas Clone Wars. The music is from the film which is good but repeats over and over. The ending looks like Lucas told them to release it now and they had no choice by meeting the deadline or maybe they wanted to be edgy and made a huge cliffhanger. Regardless people complain about this game needing a sequel. I paid about $3-$5 for this game and I gotta say ordering a Big Mac from McDonalds is more enjoyable.

The command system was very good. I think I would have preferred to add one extra member to the team so I could sit back and let them finish the rest game by themselves.

number of helpful: 5 of 46 people (11%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 18, 2015
												I am legitimately confused at why this game is so highly recommended in the Star Wars library. Seriously? What's so special about Republic Commando? The story was complete wank, first off. Everything was just one battlefield to another with no special connection. They try to tie them in with some "mystery" arc, but I never believed it, as they'd drop all sorts of ideas minutes after you'd hear them. The characters are all pretty stereotypical war game types: Boss is the Leader, Scorch is the Joker, Fixer is the... Fixer. However, I'll give it to Sev for being my favorite character. You'd figure in the middle of the war with all those millions of clones there'd be at least one who loved killing things, and that's really why I appreciate Sev so much. He's got some of the best lines in this game. But, in the contrast, Scorch has some of the WORST. He comes off as such forced humor, I'd constantly sigh a contemptuous breath every time he'd utter another snarky comment about the situation. And he has a limited number of dialogue options, so I'd hear those bloody jokes over and over and OVER again, till I wanted to strangle Scorch with my bare hands. On top of all this, the gameplay is hardly anything to brag about. It feels like the game was trying to be something of a Strategy game combined with an FPS years before Mass Effect came out and really solidified that type of game, and RC's attempt is just really... sloppy. The Strategy elements are simple and once you give your teammates something to do, the battle is pretty much in your favor. NEVER let them be idle, because the AI in this game is horrific, and the game itself is suscepticle to numerous glitches that'd often have me restart from my last save to make sure Fixer got in the bloody turret. The FPS gameplay in this is also totally off. The machine gun should- and again, for emphasis, should- be a moderate gun, but it's the weakest in your arsenal. Your pistol does more damage than it. I'm not kidding. Whenever I'd spray a Super Battle Droid with my machine gun, it felt about as effective and satisfying as spraying them with a water gun. There were parts I started to have fun in this constant, repetive shooting and running exercise, when I'd plan a bunch of traps for the enemies, but remember how bad the AI is? The enemies would just stand there, telepathically knowing all the traps I had cleverly laid down, putting all my work to shame, and putting me back into the monotony of shooting, commanding, covering, and running. The environments themselves lack a lot of vivid color. They're all greys and darker colors so it has this very muddy-like feel about it. For what it's worth, I'll give the game one other credit besides Sev. The windshield wiper. If you know anyone who's played it or if you've played it yourself- EVERYONE remembers the windshield wiper. It's a cute, humorous little thing. I liked it. But, seriously, though, that ending? I won't spoil anything, but it literally felt like the game had run out of ideas and just decided to end where it was, even though there was a story somewhere that needed to be finished, so they shoved in a couple BS lines (delivered by Yoda, of all people), and the game just... ends. I felt unsatisfied, bored, and ultimately angry with this Star Wars game. I really can't see a reason why other people like this one, but I'll always remember the windshield wiper. Forever. Everything else is just crap.

As leader of an elite squad of Republic Commandos, your mission is to infiltrate, dominate, and ultimately, annihilate the enemy. Your squad will follow your orders and your lead, working together as a team - instinctively, intelligently, instantly. You are their leader. They are your weapon. content:
Posted: September 19, 2015
												Republic Commando is a pretty unique game... well for Star Wars, but nevermind that. It's refreshing to see a Star Wars story that doesn't care about light/dark side schenanigans. You never pick up a lightsaber, you never listen to sage jedi wisdom, you never even hear a single jedi voice. Rather, it takes the standard 4-man tactical blah blah blah and puts it IN SPAAAAAACE. However, Republic Commando does one unforgivable thing that pisses me off to no end: It throws infinitely respawning enemies against you while giving you limited ammunition. You're suppose to tactically flank these enemy spawners and draw fire as a squadmate goes to disarm it. However, the game seems to forget about this premise by the second half of the game. There's a specific part late in the game where there are several of these enemy spawners at the top of a stairwell, with no other path foward. The only thing you can do is just brute force your way through it. Then the near exact same scenario is repeated again. It's like moving a truck by repeatedly punching it, hoping it moves far enough before your fist breaks. I could forgive the game if this just happened once or twice, but the second half of the game is FILLED with these sort of scenarios. The game is definitely interesting enough to bring you through to the end. However, it was an experience that I stopped enjoying about halfway through. However, the parts without said enemy spawners were fun and possibly worth the price of admission.

content:
Posted: May 13, 2015
												I recommend this game only for people who want to play a STAR WARS game that doesn't have Jedi in it. If you like military shooters or STAR WARS games, this game is mediocre at being both. STAR WARS Republic Commando takes place in the events that happen before episode 2 and episode 3 of the prequel trilogy. You are Delta 38 (voiced by Temuera Morrison himself) is the squad leader of Delta Squad; a clone commando unit. Your squad is sent on covert and high risk missions against the separatist forces. The rest of your squad (not voiced by Temuera Morrison) follow your orders as you tactically move through the missions to with the day. The biggest problem I have with this game are the weapons. Your main weapon, the blaster rifle, in particular is frustrating for how weak and inaccurate it is. It looks like a toy, and kicks like a mouse. Looking down the iron sights of this weapon doesn't do much for your accuracy and it takes up practically the whole screen while slowing you down to a walking pace. Your other weapons are a sniper rifle and a grenade launcher, but their ammo is scarce. This effectively forces you to use said blaster rifle most of the time. Although the game has special weapons you can pick up and use, many don't have the punch to really make a difference. The second aspect to this game is your squad. Your squad mates can be ordered to take up sniping positions; demolish targets; attack targets you mark etc. The squad are pretty interesting in their own right as they all have personalities that show in their dialogue and appearance. For AI characters, they stand out for being competent and effective. There were times I was hacking, or attaching a demolition charge and not receiving a scratch from the enemy. Not much else can be said about them really, except they have personalities and are competent squad mates. In 2005 (and today at times), that was impressive. The tactical aspect of this game is where this game fails. Its as deep as a kiddie pool, and not very complex. If you played games like Ghost recon or Rainbow Six; don't expect the same to challenge you. To have your squad snipe, use their grenade launcher, or even throw grenades you have to assign one of them to a designated spot and simply push a button. Maneuvers are assigned squad wide with no option to order a single soldier to defend a position or follow you. With this lack of flexibility to order your squad around, can make any veteran of tactical shooters disappointed and frustrated.In conclusion, this is one of those games that just hasn't aged well. It was impressive for its time, but there isn't anything enduring that can make it last as a classic. Aside from being a STAR WARS game without the iconic Jedi, there is nothing this game does that hasn't done better before or since in other games.

content:
Posted: May 7, 2015
												What a waste of $3...So, as is typical for games these days, the first level is all tutorial where you'll be told about HUD details, squad functions and key mappings in a rushed and unclear manner (think Elder Scrolls Online tutorial level). Irritating and boring but I kept playing and hoped it got better. It didn't, there wasn't a single moment where I shared my AI squadmate's enthusiasm or had an "oh ♥♥♥♥ yeah!" moment. It already feels like a Call of Duty: Star Wars mod with blander graphics. I gave up by the time I got deeper into Geonosys where there's these "elite" Geonosian bugs. Let me talk about the shooting micro mechanics here. Simply put, your aim is as bad as the Stormtroopers in the original SW trilogy (like when there were 5 troopers firing at a Luke standing in the open with no cover at the end of episode 4). You have an aiming reticle the size of a quarter and your shots will fire randomly within the circle meaning nearly EACH enemy will require an entire clip of ammuntion (no increased accuracy for controlled firing) and that's if you're aiming well! Now there's plenty of ammo pick ups laying around and perhaps this is just my personal taste but I can't ♥♥♥♥ing stand missing if my aim is dead on, and spending my entire munitions stores (max ammo count of 300) to kill just a few very basic grunt enemies is fackin' ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t.Then you're fighting these bugs that are jumping around like some kind of Spiderman-Batman hybrid, you got 15 different guys saying 15 different things on your comms, there's a damned earthquake going on so now your accuracy is REALLY ♥♥♥♥ed! It's like playing with some ADHD ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ whose laughing and jerking your mouse around on you while you're trying to play and your bullets are going all over the place!Where I finally said, "♥♥♥♥ it" and exited the game was when you meet these "elite" enemy types that I think are unkillable to me and there's an unlimited wave of grunt enemies coming at you. I spent over 900 rounds (thats grabbing ammo packs and resupplying to maxumum 3 times) trying to kill one single elite and he still wouldn't die. I couldn't revive a squadmate without getting gangraped by the constantly respawning enemies and the elite bug firing that sustained laser blast at me (you're vulnerable and interuptable for a few seconds when attempting to revive a squadmate).Final thoughts.It's just not fun, not even the SW name brought any enjoyment. Feels like a cash grab COD clone. Playing as a Republic Commando I think would actually be a fun premise for a COD clone, but its the♥♥♥♥♥♥controls and horrible ♥♥♥♥ing aim that kill it. It's like they thought making things as simple as killing bad guys should be needlessly complicated. It's only the first level and the most basic of enemies are taking an entire clip because your aim is so ♥♥♥♥ing stupid. Whoever thought this was a good idea should be fired. It literally ruins the game. At 3 dollars, I'd rather have bought two 40 oz malt liquors - I'm not kidding.I give this game 2 beers out of 10.

content:
Posted: January 11, 2015
												I felt the need to review this game since I bought it based on all the glowing, positive reviews it got. After actually playing it myself, however, I can say that most of these people must be delusional or something.Let me just start off by saying that the game IS really fun. The squad dynamic (when it actually works) is great to play around with in strategic situations and the characters are all interesting enough to make this come alive in some missions. The game also, apparently, ties into some of the books by the same name.While I would recommend this game to fans of Star Wars and the FPS genre in particular, it's ten years old at this point and has not really aged very well. Aside from that there are bugs and glitches everywhere on top of just poor design choices and lazy coding.Let's just got down the list, shall we? First off is the bugs. Oh the bugs. Enemies can sometimes shoot you straight through solid walls or between tiny cracks in scenery that you are unable to fire back through yourself. Trying to throw a grenade into enemy formations from behind cover will frequently have your grenades bouncing back at your own team often off of what seems to be thin air. Needless to say the hit detection sucks a fat one.Next thing is the AI, which is pretty bad for a game that revolves around a squad dynamic. I've lost count of how many times I've had to solo an encounter because my super elite delta squad members charge out strait into both mine and enemy fire or stood directly on a grenade that I just threw only to have other squad members rush out to try and revive them and also get obliterated. I had two instances where a squad member got stuck on map details because of bad path finding. The first instance had a squad member running straight into a rock trying to get to some waypoint or something and no command would pull him back so I had to fight a boss with just two squad members. The second was a bit later and a single member got stuck under a ramp of some kind because whatever command I gave him made him try to walk straight into the ramp so I ended up reloading. The enemy AI is a bit better but there's been a couple times where they've ignored a turret or something blasting away at them while they try to charge straight at me or a squad member.Next is the difficulty. I played on normal and I was basically quick saving and quick loading for every, single room. Some enemies can kill you in a single shot while others are just difficult to spot, will dodge out of your targeting reticle when you aim at them and never miss. There's also a strange disconnect with weapon damage. The Trandoshans in particular can often take an entire clip of ammo to the chest and keep coming but are supposed to just be regular enemies. They have this shotgun weapon you can pick up that you use to kill them in one or two hits but you have to basically ram it up their noses, at which point, you might as well just melee them. They however can use it to take half your health in a single shot from across an entire room.Last of all is simply that the game design itself is somewhat flawed on a fundamental level. Each mission has only a single path that you will ever go down. Sometimes they make it LOOK like you can maybe try different approaches or go a different way but there's really only one direction that is the "right" way and all others will lead to certain death. On top of this the core idea, squad command, just doesn't work properly most of the time. For example: I give the command that I want someone to take up a sniper position so my demolitions or close combat squad member will take up the position and gripe about how they're not a sniper. Then enemies will show up and they'll snipe the crap outta them no trouble while the actual sniper character just stands next to me looking rather stupid.In the end the game is actually pretty fun to play. I mean I'm certainly determined to beat it despite all these glaring issues but then I'm also a huge Star Wars / FPS fan. I'm not very good at writing reviews but, again, I felt the need to do so since everyone is recommending this game and not bothering to mention any of the very serious problems that absolutely plague the gameplay. Although seeing as I'm just a single voice surrounded by hundreds of other reviews, I doubt anyone will see this but, here it is.If you love Star Wars and FPS games get this one on sale. Otherwise, give it a miss.

												For a Tactical FPS, this game is surprisingly uninspiring. I'm a big fan of SWAT 4 and the complexity of the command system you can use with your squad in that game. They're also incredibly stupid; why they don't take cover behind obstacles and barriers automatically I couldn't guess. What a disappointment. **

content:
Posted: April 24, 2013
												This is a terrible game.  Do not buy it unless you really love all things Star Wars.  The entire game, you fight the same basic 4 enemies.  Yes, there are a few more types, but they special, rare types like a few mini-bosses.    Your characters never improve and you never find better gear other than what you start with after the tutorial mission.  You can pick up one temporary drop from enemies, but there are only af ew types of weapons you can use, and only until your ammo runs out.You end up doing the same thing most every scenerio, only the scenery is different.  Combat is very wonkly.  You can be at full shields and health and instantly die.  You can also be standing infront of a squad of enemies who never seem to hit you.  It is very inconsistent.  Your AI squad loves to run off and die unless you keep tight control over them.  This is suppoed to be a squad of "elite commandos', mind you.The developers had very few tricks in thier bag, and all they do is the same tricks over and over with increasing intensity.This game really ins't worth your time, let alone any actual money you might spend on it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 29, 2014
												This game is such a great classic game!I bought it when it was on sale and since then I didn't really find time to play it, but when I was younger I used to play the sh*t out of it!This game is one of the few FPS where one can actually care for the characters in the game, not like in CoD where everyone is a generic constellation of polygons...And that's kind of odd, clones being more different from one another than those "realistic" soldiers in recent games..In the following text I'll state some of the most important things and I hope, that one day you will like this game as much as I do!Graphics and atmosphere:The graphics are old, but what does one expect from a nearly 10 years old game?Nevertheless it's still perfectly playable, the sceneries are filled with atmosphere, the levels change from desert like design to a more futuristic design and then jump back into a even more primal design. (I don't want to spoil anything, so I won't mention the actual places.)_______________________________________Characters:You are the Boss. Like for real, his nickname is Boss. You are the commander of a squad of specially trained clone troopers, called Republic Commandos (roll credits). The rest of your squad are clones aswell, who could've figuered... and they also got special personalities; Scorch, your buddy when it comes to set up some explosives! But don't be fooled by his profession, he is the calmest one and has a joke ready for almost every situation.Sev, his long ranged abilites are only matched by his cold personality. He is your team's sniper, a rather quite guy but nevertheless still an awesome character. To say it in other words: "Sev is a pretty cool guy, he kills aliens and doesn't afraid of anything." (Got the refefrence?)Fixer, fixing stuff that wasn't even damaged in the first place. Fixer is your computer hacking professional and has traits of both other team mates, focused on the mission, but still in for a good old joke!_______________________________________Soundtrack:This. Theme. Is. Dope. Period.Seriously, the Song "Vode An" is a song written in the old language of a fictional warrior cult, called "Mandalorians". This catchy tune was performed by a choir and goose bumps are guaranteed!And that was only the main menu!In the rest of the game you're able to enjoy different songs and resamples of the music from Episode 1-3 (Some people may dislike those movies, but the music was great though!)_______________________________________Controls:The controls are normal FPS controls and even a new player only needs a few minutes to understand the controls.It may not feel as fluent as in more recent games, for example the fact, that weapons have a fixed accuracy, that doesn't change when you fire more bullets, might look a bit clunky compared to our New-Era-Games._______________________________________Gameplay:You are the commander of a elite troop of soldiers, so you are suited to be able to withstand even the greatest problems, against all odds. Well, aslong as you are using cover and you're able to aim!Speaking of cover, you can order your 3 different squadmates to do things like:Slice that console, commando!We could nee some explosives here!Assign sniper position!Mount that turret!Those are just some of the commands, during a playthrough you are able to encounter various more._______________________________________Storytelling:Like I mentioned before, you will encounter different level designs, depending on your progress.Every mission has various levels and when you completed your mission, you are deployed somewhere else, just like a real Clone-Trooper!The game follows a chronological path and takes place in the time between Episode 2 and 3. Most of the places you visit are part of the new trilogy viewers of these films will recognize them._______________________________________TL;DRGraphics+Atmosphere: 8/10 (Old but gold)Characters: 8/10 (A shooter with actual CHARACTERS!)Soundtrack: 9/10 (The music is simply stunning, just couldn't get myself to give a Halo-like 10, because Halo still owns the rank 1 most iconic music in my heart.)Controls: 7/10(Meanwhile a bit outdated, but still fine)Gameplay: 7/10 (We could have needed some more crucial commands, if you're good, you can get through without ordering most of the time)Storytelling: 7/10(Sadly just a seven from me this time, but the story is a great stand-alone story, but at the beginning of every chapter one has to understand the situation, but you get your basic intel through loading screen and an intro from your mission adviser in a cutscene like start)

Posted: May 21, 2014
												Really let's you experience a Star Wars feel that no other game has done. The squad element of the game worked great. Although it involves doing much of the same thing, and you can predict when a certian type of enemy is coming up, but it's not always that bad. Plus the game does such a great job with the gameplay mechanics and the squad's dialoge is quite entertaining in much of the game, so you don't really have a feeling of playing a boring shooter, and you actually feel like you're a part of the Delta Squad. As nerdy as that sounds, it's a great game, and I definitely think any Star Wars fan MUST play this game. **Side note; You must consider the age of this game before judging it based on graphics. For it's year, it was really an amazing game.**

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 30, 2014
												I got this game during the big annual star wars sale on may 4th and I'm glad I did. This game is one of the more overlooked games in the Star Wars franchise and that is definatly a shame. I and many others have had loads of fun with this game and I can gladly say the price is well worth it. It's a tactical FPS and that may turn some people off, but it's not very complecated and there's litte micro-management. It's actually pretty fasted paced for a tactial FPS game of it's time, you'll be blasting droids and other baddies every 30 seconds and the game never lets up until the end. It's also not very hard, but I did run into some tricky spots on my normal play through. The regular story campaign only takes about 9 hours and it has only 3 levels. However these levels never drag on and I hardly noticed they were all about the same length. It's a short game sure, but that's actually kinda nice. It starts of quickly, slows up to a nice build up at the start of level 2 and than it's full speed ahead until the credits roll. The multiplayer was run by gamespy so sadly I don't think we'll be seeing many matches of this game anymore. Either way this is still a great game and a fun reminader of days gone by.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 13, 2014
												Star Wars: Republic Commando is a criminally underrated squad-based shooter.While I'm not a fan of the FPS genre in general, I had a great time playing Republic Commando. Many zones have interesting tactics you can assign you squad, and every corner of the map is a decision. Nothing stands out as ugly, distasteful, inappropriate or awkward. The squad mate radio chatter is entertaining, to say the least.The system requirements are *incredibly* low for the experience you get. It's really quite amazing how well this will run on even a terrible computer build. Check system specifications for full details :)There's something I can't quite find the words for that makes the game special. It's a certain atmosphere or perhaps a combination of comaraderie and personal triumph. Further, players get a fair amount of replayability with difficulty settings (which really ramps up some of the more difficult scenarios). After finishing the campaigns, special features become unlocked. All the footage and developer commentary about the attention to detail the game received was definitely worth a watch.When all is said and done, I think the art style is a bit dated, but the atmosphere lives on. 9.3/10

content:
Posted: May 27, 2014
												Playing this again, in a generation where the gaming technology has vastly improved, I can say proudly that Star Wars Republic Commando still holds up absolutely. This game utterly succeeds at immersing you into the spot of a Republic Commando, and all the squad management mechanics are fantastic in their design. Despite the fact that you play as the leader of a squad of elite death-dealing supersoldiers, this game is by no means an easy one. The opponents and environments you are put in are made to overpower you, and it's only through cold, hard strategy will you perservere. The story revolves around your Squad, and is grounded quite firmly there, in that everything in the game is seen from the visor of your player-character. All in all, if you're looking for a challenging, immersive, strategic FPS, and are a fan of Star Wars, you need this game.

content:
Posted: June 18, 2014
												This is one of those games that made me smile. Although this IS one of the shortest games I've played, it was an amazing ride that just waits to be replayed. Don't be turned off because it does not have fancy graohics, gameplay before graphics to me. The game plays surprisingly well for how old it is, it has aged quite nicely. I managed to beat the campaign in one day, it's short, sweet, and a decent challenge. I also enjoy this game because it manages to tell a good story with the gameplay mechanics it has. It's a squad based tactical first person shooter. You won't be swinging any fancy lightsabers or blocking any blaster lasers, you'll be doing the unsung work of the special forces of the clone army: the Commandos; and hell if it wasn't extremely fun. Usually in first person shooters the character developement is rather shallow, well, there isn'[t much in this game either, but it fits okay! You're a CLONE, your character doesn't matter! Right? Well, yes and no. You don't have much background or sappy stories being told among Delta Squad, and well, it fits with the fact that their clones! The character did however manage to do something a lot of other games can't, make me smile! The characters, who lack personal history due to being clones, express themselves in their witty quips or comments on you. One situation was when I blew up an enemy and my squadmate on accident and one of the other members said "Command, send a replacement for 38." (38 [three eight] being your callsign). It was funny okay...THIS GAME IS WORTH THE BUY.

												8.5/10 Occasionally frustrating (those ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ scavengers!) but generally sound and worth your time. Amongst the last good games Lucasarts produced. Challenging at times, sometimes for the wrong reasons; enemies are sometimes just mobs of bulletsponges, which aren't fun to face, or damned impossible to hit.Nicely simple squad mechanics, and responsive gunplay. Weapons are varied enough to be interesting, and not so varied as to be confusing. Gameplay and level design ok, gets linear and repetetive after a while, with some contrivances (Oh look, a big room with crates and rocket ammo, I wonder what we'll be facing here....). Likeable characters who feel like the good kind of comic book soldiers, and surprisingly fun pulpy storyline, though the *ahem* emotional bit at the end falls massively flat and feels utterly irrelevant. Fits nicely into the mythos too.Not the best game ever, but nonetheless recommended.

												A thinking man's Star Wars fps. content:
Posted: December 6, 2015
												This amazing Star Wars FPS gives me great memorys back in the day. Where me and my brother would pretend we are Storm troopers. This game was so good that I had to play it over and over. I couldn't get enough of this game.Pros:This game has a great story between the crew and the battefield. The game is quick to downloud (Depends on what type of computer). Heck it even downloaded quicker than I thought on my CRAPPY PC. And, the game ran smoothly. The guns are awesome and easy to use. The teamwork and commands are cool. The crew; 07 (Sev), 62 (Scorch), and 40 (fixer), are great companions (expectialy Scorch). The connection they have is so cool, like they're so loyal they they wouldn't queston your decisions. The dialoge is amazing. The voice acting is perfect, the jokes, the commands. Everything is so perfect. Overall this game is amazing. So amazing that 5 years later you'll be coming back to this game and play it for hours. An absolute 10/10 in my book.Cons:During my gameplay, I have encountered some bugs and glitches. Sometimes the team wouldn't follow me or follow my commands, or maybe it's me. But, during the mission in Kashyyk, 07 (Sev) Decided to fall back and get stuck on some object and stand there. I did had to back track to beat him up to get him out, or just straight up ditch him. But that happened rarely. Sometimes the team would just stop as i trott though the mission ALONE! Then I back track to get them. This only happened once, and is probably just my computer acting up. The game is short, only 4 places with tons of missions, and it's range of weapons, but still enjoyable to slaughter a great amount of droids. Which is resonable, but I wish this game had a sequall, or DLCs to see more of the story and gameplay. But, overall it just depends on the computer causing the glitches, and the companys decided to leave the Star Wars fracnchise, but they gave us a great FPS game. I have an old HP computer that is reaching close to it's end and the game is running smooth. So I didn't have much problems. Just the team ditching me XDOverall this game is great. Did find it hard on some levels...like the hangars, the bomb codes, the stupid Super Battle Droids posse ganging up on me (For GODS sake SAVE me SCORCH XD). But this game gives it's moments. This game is a must for Star Wars fanatics and for FPS shooters. I give this game a 10/10 (Sorry if this review is bad. This is my first review. If I missed anything sorry, didn't want to spoil the game. And sorry if i misspelled or drifted off of the things I'm saying. ME ENGLISH NO GOOD. I hope my review gets you to play this game, its worth it to slaughter all those droids with explosive weapons and projectiles. Have fun!)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 5, 2015
In short: It's old and not exactly gold, but still a fun and challenging experience that you won't regret.About your companions:Their AI is kind of bad when left on their own.They make better defenders than you, when ordered to take a defensive spot.You have to carefully pick if you want to work a console while they cover you or if you want one of them to do it while you cover him.You can't micro-manage them individually like you can in other games. You just give an order and one of them will take care of it.If you go down, you can order them to fight on or come and pick you up. If one of them goes down, you can pick them up or order somebody to pick them up.It is best to think of your companions as mobile turrets that canbe placed in overwatch positions.About your enemies and the campaign:The game is linear and gets repetitive, but you won't mind.You run into new enemies, bigger challenges, and larger groups of enemies that make the game hardr and harder.Enemies will ambush you when you expect it and when oyu don't.There are times when it gets really crazy with multiple droid spawners that really test your ability to manage your team while under heavy fire.You have three base weapons that you have to know when to use, along with four types of grenades, but you can also pick up special enemy weapoins, like the shotgun or heavy machinegun.Each enemy is vulnerable to a weapon type and grenade type. The game will not only test you on this in bulk, but it will also mix things up.Overall: A game that still looks and plays ok after all these years.

												While this is an old game it is one of the best shooters out there. Mechanics are solid and it has a better squad system than Halo: Gaurdians. 												A good tactical shooter that reminds me of a mix of Rainbow Six 3, and Halo. Story is hit or miss depending on if you like Star Wars. The shooting is top notch and feels visceral and brutal. Its also a fairly challenging game, and has some really frustrating parts if you don't take your time. In particular there is a section that I needed a walkthrough for during the second deployment after you leave genosis. (Key hint, its the hallway of hell near the end. Shoot the turrets first.)Overall an excellent game that really makes the clone trooper the REAL star of Starwars. Silly Jedi, lightsabers are for kids.  Men use blasters.

content:
Posted: December 6, 2015
												Republic commando is an awesome game in multiple aspects: pro's  Great voice acting by the original Temuera Morrison Good and entertaining story Unique FPS which uses squad dynamics. You are the boss, you are the one giving your three other squadmates their orders, be it sniping positions, slice that console! Get some Bacta, Man that turret! Take out target! Form up! Defend position! Seek and destroy! and many other commands, each presented in an easy, not at all difficult to understand Great AI, I've seldom seen an FPS with this wel coded AI. Your squad mates don't get in the way, take strategic cover all by themselves and are actually really helping! good weapons system, No need for upgrading all the time, These are your weapons: use them to win the war. They did add a fifth slot for temporary special weapons that can be found in the game. The game has great animations, even though the game itself is old and hasn't got the greatest graphics, the animations are well done, they look fluent and don't stutter when you give your commando's new orders. Few to no bugs. I've completed the game and haven't encountered a single bug. Maybe I was lucky but I don't think so. Cons  Story is pretty short (I want moar!!) Multiplayer now needs a 3d party tool because gamespy servers are no longer up. You never get to see what you look like :P

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 27, 2014
												Playing this again, in a generation where the gaming technology has vastly improved, I can say proudly that Star Wars Republic Commando still holds up absolutely. This game utterly succeeds at immersing you into the spot of a Republic Commando, and all the squad management mechanics are fantastic in their design. Despite the fact that you play as the leader of a squad of elite death-dealing supersoldiers, this game is by no means an easy one. The opponents and environments you are put in are made to overpower you, and it's only through cold, hard strategy will you perservere. The story revolves around your Squad, and is grounded quite firmly there, in that everything in the game is seen from the visor of your player-character. All in all, if you're looking for a challenging, immersive, strategic FPS, and are a fan of Star Wars, you need this game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 30, 2014
												I got this game during the big annual star wars sale on may 4th and I'm glad I did. This game is one of the more overlooked games in the Star Wars franchise and that is definatly a shame. I and many others have had loads of fun with this game and I can gladly say the price is well worth it. It's a tactical FPS and that may turn some people off, but it's not very complecated and there's litte micro-management. It's actually pretty fasted paced for a tactial FPS game of it's time, you'll be blasting droids and other baddies every 30 seconds and the game never lets up until the end. It's also not very hard, but I did run into some tricky spots on my normal play through. The regular story campaign only takes about 9 hours and it has only 3 levels. However these levels never drag on and I hardly noticed they were all about the same length. It's a short game sure, but that's actually kinda nice. It starts of quickly, slows up to a nice build up at the start of level 2 and than it's full speed ahead until the credits roll. The multiplayer was run by gamespy so sadly I don't think we'll be seeing many matches of this game anymore. Either way this is still a great game and a fun reminader of days gone by.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 29, 2014
												This game is such a great classic game!I bought it when it was on sale and since then I didn't really find time to play it, but when I was younger I used to play the sh*t out of it!This game is one of the few FPS where one can actually care for the characters in the game, not like in CoD where everyone is a generic constellation of polygons...And that's kind of odd, clones being more different from one another than those "realistic" soldiers in recent games..In the following text I'll state some of the most important things and I hope, that one day you will like this game as much as I do!Graphics and atmosphere:The graphics are old, but what does one expect from a nearly 10 years old game?Nevertheless it's still perfectly playable, the sceneries are filled with atmosphere, the levels change from desert like design to a more futuristic design and then jump back into a even more primal design. (I don't want to spoil anything, so I won't mention the actual places.)_______________________________________Characters:You are the Boss. Like for real, his nickname is Boss. You are the commander of a squad of specially trained clone troopers, called Republic Commandos (roll credits). The rest of your squad are clones aswell, who could've figuered... and they also got special personalities; Scorch, your buddy when it comes to set up some explosives! But don't be fooled by his profession, he is the calmest one and has a joke ready for almost every situation.Sev, his long ranged abilites are only matched by his cold personality. He is your team's sniper, a rather quite guy but nevertheless still an awesome character. To say it in other words: "Sev is a pretty cool guy, he kills aliens and doesn't afraid of anything." (Got the refefrence?)Fixer, fixing stuff that wasn't even damaged in the first place. Fixer is your computer hacking professional and has traits of both other team mates, focused on the mission, but still in for a good old joke!_______________________________________Soundtrack:This. Theme. Is. Dope. Period.Seriously, the Song "Vode An" is a song written in the old language of a fictional warrior cult, called "Mandalorians". This catchy tune was performed by a choir and goose bumps are guaranteed!And that was only the main menu!In the rest of the game you're able to enjoy different songs and resamples of the music from Episode 1-3 (Some people may dislike those movies, but the music was great though!)_______________________________________Controls:The controls are normal FPS controls and even a new player only needs a few minutes to understand the controls.It may not feel as fluent as in more recent games, for example the fact, that weapons have a fixed accuracy, that doesn't change when you fire more bullets, might look a bit clunky compared to our New-Era-Games._______________________________________Gameplay:You are the commander of a elite troop of soldiers, so you are suited to be able to withstand even the greatest problems, against all odds. Well, aslong as you are using cover and you're able to aim!Speaking of cover, you can order your 3 different squadmates to do things like:Slice that console, commando!We could nee some explosives here!Assign sniper position!Mount that turret!Those are just some of the commands, during a playthrough you are able to encounter various more._______________________________________Storytelling:Like I mentioned before, you will encounter different level designs, depending on your progress.Every mission has various levels and when you completed your mission, you are deployed somewhere else, just like a real Clone-Trooper!The game follows a chronological path and takes place in the time between Episode 2 and 3. Most of the places you visit are part of the new trilogy viewers of these films will recognize them._______________________________________TL;DRGraphics+Atmosphere: 8/10 (Old but gold)Characters: 8/10 (A shooter with actual CHARACTERS!)Soundtrack: 9/10 (The music is simply stunning, just couldn't get myself to give a Halo-like 10, because Halo still owns the rank 1 most iconic music in my heart.)Controls: 7/10(Meanwhile a bit outdated, but still fine)Gameplay: 7/10 (We could have needed some more crucial commands, if you're good, you can get through without ordering most of the time)Storytelling: 7/10(Sadly just a seven from me this time, but the story is a great stand-alone story, but at the beginning of every chapter one has to understand the situation, but you get your basic intel through loading screen and an intro from your mission adviser in a cutscene like start)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 13, 2014
												Star Wars: Republic Commando is a criminally underrated squad-based shooter.While I'm not a fan of the FPS genre in general, I had a great time playing Republic Commando. Many zones have interesting tactics you can assign you squad, and every corner of the map is a decision. Nothing stands out as ugly, distasteful, inappropriate or awkward. The squad mate radio chatter is entertaining, to say the least.The system requirements are *incredibly* low for the experience you get. It's really quite amazing how well this will run on even a terrible computer build. Check system specifications for full details :)There's something I can't quite find the words for that makes the game special. It's a certain atmosphere or perhaps a combination of comaraderie and personal triumph. Further, players get a fair amount of replayability with difficulty settings (which really ramps up some of the more difficult scenarios). After finishing the campaigns, special features become unlocked. All the footage and developer commentary about the attention to detail the game received was definitely worth a watch.When all is said and done, I think the art style is a bit dated, but the atmosphere lives on. 9.3/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 3, 2014
												I'm not a big fan of FPSers, mainly because I can't shoot strait, but I'm a big fan of Star Wars, so I decided to give this a try... And I wasn't disappointed!The story starts during the Clone War (before Episode III) and you play as the leader of Delta Squad, an elite combat unit. Your squad members are: Delta 07 (sniper) - code name: SEV, Delta 40 (tech) - code name: FIXER and Delta 62 (demo) - code name: SCORCH. The objective: galactic cleanup.First, let me say, that the VA is fantastic. It's light-hearted, well-written and performed to perfection. You are in the middle of a war, but it never gets too serious, which is good for someone like me, who are not fans of the genre. Jonathan David Cook (07), Temuera Morrison (38), Andrew Chaikin (40) and Raphael Sbarge (62) must be applauded!The gameplay is smooth and uncomplicated and the controls are easy. In regards to difficulty, easy really is EASY, and it only gets a little tougher once you progress.The story is linear... and it works brilliantly. It would hate to see this in an open world environment. It sticks to what it is, a simple fps, that gives you a sense of what you're doing.If I have to say anything negative about this game, it would be that it is too short. You can complete it in a day.In conclusion: if you are looking for an uncomplicated and fun fps, this is it! It feels like Star Wars, and that is important to me.
