number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 5, 2014
												A childhood game and one of the best that I played on the Xbox. However I lost the game much to my own displeasure, but after reaquiring it on steam; it feels so good to relive the old memories. The game's story, characters, enivronment, and items all match the universe that its in, and ties in very well with the first mission being on Genosis in Star Wars II: The clone wars, and  the battle on kashyyk. Being a leader never felt like so much fun and really has to make you think on what's the best strategy to get you and your squad through, since you maybe a elite clone, but your nothing without your squad; and that's what I see as the game's biggest strength: Delta Squad. There is at least one member in Delta Squad you can bond with and all of them have distinct and unique personalities and voices, as well as specialites (i.e Fixer being control panels and breaching; Sev for sniping and heavy weapons; and Scorch for demolitions and breaches). As for yourself being in the boots of Delta Squad Leader 38, a direct clone from Jango Fett himself, are the brains of the group.The A.i for the squad can be a bit iffy, such as sometimes not firing at an enemy when they are standing right infront of them, or even sometimes can be rarely caught suspended in the air (happened once with scorch, though going into the next level fixed this). However that still doesn't change the fact that the A.I for the game was very much implemented in how it should. Squad mates would take cover, throw back grenades that were tossed at them, heal themselves and revive downed squadmates, there was no need to think about babysitting, and they could handle themself especially if you place in them in a good formation, and even when you go down, they can take care of the battle before helping you back up to your feet.This game has topped halo for me personally, and I will always come back to this game to try out new strategies and tougher difficulites to see if I can really be a true leader~!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 5, 2014
												Star Wars Republic Comando may just be the best Star Wars game ever released.The whole gameplay experience is like watching a classic Star Wars movie that just doesn't end. Hours of ongoing scenery dialogs followed by an outstanding OST. I am not a Star Wars fan whatsoever, but I will admit it, this game is a must-have for anyone seriously into Star Wars franchise, or even into games with great storyline.Pros:-Linear gameplay, movie-like experience.-An outstanding OST.-Decent graphics and design for a game made almost a decade ago.-Smart AI, a thing so rare in games nowadays.-Intuitive squad controls.-Many hours of fun.Cons:-Buggy graphics with modern hardware (ATI/AMD cards won't support the buggy bumpmap on Medium or High and will crash the game)-3D sound drivers are not properly compatible with newer sound cards.Should you buy this game, even a decade after its release? YES. I played this long ago, and I just couldn't resist of playing it again. The moment you launch the game and the main menu OST kicks in, you're set for a journey.I completed the campaign for about 9 hours on Medium.

content:
Posted: December 6, 2015
												This amazing Star Wars FPS gives me great memorys back in the day. Where me and my brother would pretend we are Storm troopers. This game was so good that I had to play it over and over. I couldn't get enough of this game.Pros:This game has a great story between the crew and the battefield. The game is quick to downloud (Depends on what type of computer). Heck it even downloaded quicker than I thought on my CRAPPY PC. And, the game ran smoothly. The guns are awesome and easy to use. The teamwork and commands are cool. The crew; 07 (Sev), 62 (Scorch), and 40 (fixer), are great companions (expectialy Scorch). The connection they have is so cool, like they're so loyal they they wouldn't queston your decisions. The dialoge is amazing. The voice acting is perfect, the jokes, the commands. Everything is so perfect. Overall this game is amazing. So amazing that 5 years later you'll be coming back to this game and play it for hours. An absolute 10/10 in my book.Cons:During my gameplay, I have encountered some bugs and glitches. Sometimes the team wouldn't follow me or follow my commands, or maybe it's me. But, during the mission in Kashyyk, 07 (Sev) Decided to fall back and get stuck on some object and stand there. I did had to back track to beat him up to get him out, or just straight up ditch him. But that happened rarely. Sometimes the team would just stop as i trott though the mission ALONE! Then I back track to get them. This only happened once, and is probably just my computer acting up. The game is short, only 4 places with tons of missions, and it's range of weapons, but still enjoyable to slaughter a great amount of droids. Which is resonable, but I wish this game had a sequall, or DLCs to see more of the story and gameplay. But, overall it just depends on the computer causing the glitches, and the companys decided to leave the Star Wars fracnchise, but they gave us a great FPS game. I have an old HP computer that is reaching close to it's end and the game is running smooth. So I didn't have much problems. Just the team ditching me XDOverall this game is great. Did find it hard on some levels...like the hangars, the bomb codes, the stupid Super Battle Droids posse ganging up on me (For GODS sake SAVE me SCORCH XD). But this game gives it's moments. This game is a must for Star Wars fanatics and for FPS shooters. I give this game a 10/10 (Sorry if this review is bad. This is my first review. If I missed anything sorry, didn't want to spoil the game. And sorry if i misspelled or drifted off of the things I'm saying. ME ENGLISH NO GOOD. I hope my review gets you to play this game, its worth it to slaughter all those droids with explosive weapons and projectiles. Have fun!)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 5, 2015
In short: It's old and not exactly gold, but still a fun and challenging experience that you won't regret.About your companions:Their AI is kind of bad when left on their own.They make better defenders than you, when ordered to take a defensive spot.You have to carefully pick if you want to work a console while they cover you or if you want one of them to do it while you cover him.You can't micro-manage them individually like you can in other games. You just give an order and one of them will take care of it.If you go down, you can order them to fight on or come and pick you up. If one of them goes down, you can pick them up or order somebody to pick them up.It is best to think of your companions as mobile turrets that canbe placed in overwatch positions.About your enemies and the campaign:The game is linear and gets repetitive, but you won't mind.You run into new enemies, bigger challenges, and larger groups of enemies that make the game hardr and harder.Enemies will ambush you when you expect it and when oyu don't.There are times when it gets really crazy with multiple droid spawners that really test your ability to manage your team while under heavy fire.You have three base weapons that you have to know when to use, along with four types of grenades, but you can also pick up special enemy weapoins, like the shotgun or heavy machinegun.Each enemy is vulnerable to a weapon type and grenade type. The game will not only test you on this in bulk, but it will also mix things up.Overall: A game that still looks and plays ok after all these years.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 3, 2015
												I'm terrible at this game, but I like it a lot. Something about the quiet teamwork of Delta Squad is a lot more confidence-inspiring than the most ooh-rah COD/Rainbow Six/Battlefield games. Granted, this game has defunct/crappy multiplayer, and might seem like a rail-shooter to a jumping headshot ninja master, but as a single-player mid-tough FPS experience, it's definitely my speed.Smart tactics are a necessity in the most contested firefights. Suppressing fire, sniping, armor, and grenadier work by your squad mates are the only way to get through some of the battles. While there's a puzzly/"find the boss's' blind spot" feel to some of the fights, the game strikes a good balance between working your reflexes and rewarding smart choices.After Tie Fighter and KOTOR, this is my favorite Star Wars game. Pour one out for the LucasArts/THQ teams of old. I hope someone picks up this IP and makes a sequel.Maybe they can combine this with the Jedi Academy engine for a Force Awakens spin-off! I hope the Lucasfilm people will consider that, as they enjoy their brandy and cigars while sunning themselves by their rooftop swimming pool full of money.

content:
Posted: June 18, 2014
												This is one of those games that made me smile. Although this IS one of the shortest games I've played, it was an amazing ride that just waits to be replayed. Don't be turned off because it does not have fancy graohics, gameplay before graphics to me. The game plays surprisingly well for how old it is, it has aged quite nicely. I managed to beat the campaign in one day, it's short, sweet, and a decent challenge. I also enjoy this game because it manages to tell a good story with the gameplay mechanics it has. It's a squad based tactical first person shooter. You won't be swinging any fancy lightsabers or blocking any blaster lasers, you'll be doing the unsung work of the special forces of the clone army: the Commandos; and hell if it wasn't extremely fun. Usually in first person shooters the character developement is rather shallow, well, there isn'[t much in this game either, but it fits okay! You're a CLONE, your character doesn't matter! Right? Well, yes and no. You don't have much background or sappy stories being told among Delta Squad, and well, it fits with the fact that their clones! The character did however manage to do something a lot of other games can't, make me smile! The characters, who lack personal history due to being clones, express themselves in their witty quips or comments on you. One situation was when I blew up an enemy and my squadmate on accident and one of the other members said "Command, send a replacement for 38." (38 [three eight] being your callsign). It was funny okay...THIS GAME IS WORTH THE BUY.

												Simply put, awesome game.It really gets into your mind, you know?No fancy Jedis, or Jedi powers. Just you, your brothers, weapons, armor, and the war.Good element of tactics. SEQUEL!This game is cheap enough. For FPS freaks like me, GET IT.PS: Its got a "crash upon startup and/or load" problem that has never been solved and is related to its bump-mapping. Thankfully, it solved it for me.Set bump-mapping low to prevent crashing, and set everything else as high as you can.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 16, 2014
												8.5/10 Occasionally frustrating (those ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ scavengers!) but generally sound and worth your time. Amongst the last good games Lucasarts produced. Challenging at times, sometimes for the wrong reasons; enemies are sometimes just mobs of bulletsponges, which aren't fun to face, or damned impossible to hit.Nicely simple squad mechanics, and responsive gunplay. Weapons are varied enough to be interesting, and not so varied as to be confusing. Gameplay and level design ok, gets linear and repetetive after a while, with some contrivances (Oh look, a big room with crates and rocket ammo, I wonder what we'll be facing here....). Likeable characters who feel like the good kind of comic book soldiers, and surprisingly fun pulpy storyline, though the *ahem* emotional bit at the end falls massively flat and feels utterly irrelevant. Fits nicely into the mythos too.Not the best game ever, but nonetheless recommended.

Posted: June 19, 2014
												When this game came out in 2005 my family rented it for a short period of time (at least we were supposed to) my brother and I (mostly my brother) played this game to death. When the rental ended we had to do the only thing we could, we bought it. We finished the game within a week (being younger and all) and we lost it. Remebering this a few years later I searched for the game in our house remembering the stunning visuals for its time, the great gameplay, and the mazing A.I that was usually better than my brother and I. Not being able to find it in our house (we came to the conclusion one of my brothers friends stole it) I bought it on steam. God did I not regret that.  I was blown away I felt more enjoyment in this game than most first person shooters today. Great game. Great buy. Now get this game soldier!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 29, 2014
												This game is such a great classic game!I bought it when it was on sale and since then I didn't really find time to play it, but when I was younger I used to play the sh*t out of it!This game is one of the few FPS where one can actually care for the characters in the game, not like in CoD where everyone is a generic constellation of polygons...And that's kind of odd, clones being more different from one another than those "realistic" soldiers in recent games..In the following text I'll state some of the most important things and I hope, that one day you will like this game as much as I do!Graphics and atmosphere:The graphics are old, but what does one expect from a nearly 10 years old game?Nevertheless it's still perfectly playable, the sceneries are filled with atmosphere, the levels change from desert like design to a more futuristic design and then jump back into a even more primal design. (I don't want to spoil anything, so I won't mention the actual places.)_______________________________________Characters:You are the Boss. Like for real, his nickname is Boss. You are the commander of a squad of specially trained clone troopers, called Republic Commandos (roll credits). The rest of your squad are clones aswell, who could've figuered... and they also got special personalities; Scorch, your buddy when it comes to set up some explosives! But don't be fooled by his profession, he is the calmest one and has a joke ready for almost every situation.Sev, his long ranged abilites are only matched by his cold personality. He is your team's sniper, a rather quite guy but nevertheless still an awesome character. To say it in other words: "Sev is a pretty cool guy, he kills aliens and doesn't afraid of anything." (Got the refefrence?)Fixer, fixing stuff that wasn't even damaged in the first place. Fixer is your computer hacking professional and has traits of both other team mates, focused on the mission, but still in for a good old joke!_______________________________________Soundtrack:This. Theme. Is. Dope. Period.Seriously, the Song "Vode An" is a song written in the old language of a fictional warrior cult, called "Mandalorians". This catchy tune was performed by a choir and goose bumps are guaranteed!And that was only the main menu!In the rest of the game you're able to enjoy different songs and resamples of the music from Episode 1-3 (Some people may dislike those movies, but the music was great though!)_______________________________________Controls:The controls are normal FPS controls and even a new player only needs a few minutes to understand the controls.It may not feel as fluent as in more recent games, for example the fact, that weapons have a fixed accuracy, that doesn't change when you fire more bullets, might look a bit clunky compared to our New-Era-Games._______________________________________Gameplay:You are the commander of a elite troop of soldiers, so you are suited to be able to withstand even the greatest problems, against all odds. Well, aslong as you are using cover and you're able to aim!Speaking of cover, you can order your 3 different squadmates to do things like:Slice that console, commando!We could nee some explosives here!Assign sniper position!Mount that turret!Those are just some of the commands, during a playthrough you are able to encounter various more._______________________________________Storytelling:Like I mentioned before, you will encounter different level designs, depending on your progress.Every mission has various levels and when you completed your mission, you are deployed somewhere else, just like a real Clone-Trooper!The game follows a chronological path and takes place in the time between Episode 2 and 3. Most of the places you visit are part of the new trilogy viewers of these films will recognize them._______________________________________TL;DRGraphics+Atmosphere: 8/10 (Old but gold)Characters: 8/10 (A shooter with actual CHARACTERS!)Soundtrack: 9/10 (The music is simply stunning, just couldn't get myself to give a Halo-like 10, because Halo still owns the rank 1 most iconic music in my heart.)Controls: 7/10(Meanwhile a bit outdated, but still fine)Gameplay: 7/10 (We could have needed some more crucial commands, if you're good, you can get through without ordering most of the time)Storytelling: 7/10(Sadly just a seven from me this time, but the story is a great stand-alone story, but at the beginning of every chapter one has to understand the situation, but you get your basic intel through loading screen and an intro from your mission adviser in a cutscene like start)

content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												Republic Commando is a high action look into the Star Wars universe through the eyes of a special clone commando unit. This is a great shooter where you control your squad to kill droids and complete missions that took place during the clone wars.Each new area you visit is unique and presents a challenge as you lead your very own clone squad on special missions. Telling them to take up positions and stratigising adds a fun layer to the already excellent combat.Solid gameplay with no unresonable dificulty jumps, weapons for every occasion, and well crafted enviroments. Also, it is fun to listen to the commandos in your unit talk trash to the droids and make funny remarks.A well made shooter, all in all. I say its worth getting.

Posted: February 17, 2011
												One of the few tactical shooters I can stand, also happens to be one of the best Star Wars games in the galaxy. The shooting may be a bit dull, there may only be a few weapons and you can finish the story in one night if you have nothing better to do, but there's an odd charm to this game. The characters certainly help this by being pretty distinctive and interesting; both the voice acting and writing is top-notch. The story is pretty standard Star Wars fare, but because the lead characters are clones it's a lot less "YOU GOTSTA STOP DER SITH!!1" and a lot more "HOOAH!" In addition, the graphics still hold up well thanks to their stylized realism. Although repeditive at times, the levels are pretty great and you'd have to be as dumb as a womp rat to get lost in them. Lastly: retractable fist-knife? Coolest. Weapon. Ever.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 3, 2016
												So this is my first review of any game and I've played a lot of steam games. This particular gem was one I started long ago on the console but never got to finish it due to time constraints. I came across this during a steam sale of a collection of star wars games. That being said as soon as I discovered that I possessed this, I immediately started playing this. After beating it, it left such a good impression on me that I couldn't help but write a detailed review over it. I'll try to break things down into different categories and give my final two cents.Graphics: Considering that the game is dated back to 2005 on the XBox (literally 11 years and 2 days at the time of this review), the graphics aren't the best when you compare it to today's hi tech stuff. Once you get over that and appreciate the visuals for what it is during that time period, it is quiet a beautiful environment. All the enemies are detailed to scale, the settings you traverse look gorgeous, and the weaponry look pretty good too. I had no problems at all coursing through this game.Controls: They are somewhat clunky in certain areas. Playing off of mouse and keyboard the reaction is spot on as well is the movement. A couple times clicking the melee button on the keyboard didin't respond fast enough. My only real complaint was that the zooming feature of sniping was bit cumbersome to cycle through. Besides that tidbit the controls served me quite nicely.Audio: The musical score and scripts were fantastic. From creepy like scenes to the traditional star wars trumpeting to the more militaristic theme song of the clone troopers, the game didn't fail to bring you into the enviroment. During fights did I tune it out but it served well as ambiance. The dialog in the game is by far the shining point of this game. As the main character Delta 38 your character is voiced by Temuera Morrison aka Jango Fett. From issuing orders to commenting on the story to talking to his squadmates, one doesn't get tired of hearing his voice. Ontop of the other 3 troopers and the advisor, you really feel like you're a leader issuing orders and expanding the story. The inner dialogue between each trooper is quite appreciative. It would have made the game a bit dull if each trooper didn't have their own personality.Story: The story of a commando unit is pretty immersive. You get a quick setup of your origins and meet your team. After the brief prologue you go through stage after stage uncovering a bigger plot involved for the level as you complete each objective. From my perspective I never really gave much thought about the over arching story. I think that was the point of the game. You're a soldier and the information you're given is a need to know basis or stumbling across it as events unfold. The only true negative in all of this is that you are left on a cliff hanger and that the supposed sequel for this game is on hiatus. Gamplay: I played this game on hard so I used QuickSave a LOT to get through the game. There were moments that you felt overwhelmed as you have pretty stacked odds of tough AI against you followed by pride when you accomplished it. The real difficulty wasn't the tough enemies or type of enemies or amount of enemies but how flimsy your main character was. I didn't play normal so I have no idea what the differences are. The AI could hit harder and last longer. My character could have shorter life. Maybe there are more enemies. Either way it was pretty apparent that your comrades could tank quite a bit whereas that same punishment applied to you would floor you in less than a second. It was the number one negative in the game. I get that on hard you're a bit weaker life wise but make it consistent with your squadmates. I went through the game issuing orders to kill certain enemies or reviving me while I would run and gun around cover when I was up. Besides that, completing the game on hard felt pretty rewarding. The hardest moment in the game is to accomplish an objective within 5 minutes else you lose. Oh yeah don't forget the hoards of enemies that are between you and your object. Nearing the end of each level meant that the punches were no longer pulled as you faced wave after wave of super enemies instead of scrubs. You felt a sense of accomplisment finishing that level.Overall thought: This game is worth getting. Full price? Probably not. I'd wait for a sale but when you get it, I highly recommed to play through the game on hard. There are no achievements just you, some grit, and your 3 commandos against the Separatists. Just make sure you have the patience for it. I finished this game in 17 hours. No doubt the amount of times to restart a certain section over and over to perfection probably contributed to that length of time. Lastly you see a side of the star wars universe through the eyes of a soldier. A badass one at that. That alone makes the game worth getting and beating. It is simply sad that the sequel may never come to life and simply leaving you on a cliffhanger.Rating: 9/10

content:
Posted: April 3, 2014
												I'm not a big fan of FPSers, mainly because I can't shoot strait, but I'm a big fan of Star Wars, so I decided to give this a try... And I wasn't disappointed!The story starts during the Clone War (before Episode III) and you play as the leader of Delta Squad, an elite combat unit. Your squad members are: Delta 07 (sniper) - code name: SEV, Delta 40 (tech) - code name: FIXER and Delta 62 (demo) - code name: SCORCH. The objective: galactic cleanup.First, let me say, that the VA is fantastic. It's light-hearted, well-written and performed to perfection. You are in the middle of a war, but it never gets too serious, which is good for someone like me, who are not fans of the genre. Jonathan David Cook (07), Temuera Morrison (38), Andrew Chaikin (40) and Raphael Sbarge (62) must be applauded!The gameplay is smooth and uncomplicated and the controls are easy. In regards to difficulty, easy really is EASY, and it only gets a little tougher once you progress.The story is linear... and it works brilliantly. It would hate to see this in an open world environment. It sticks to what it is, a simple fps, that gives you a sense of what you're doing.If I have to say anything negative about this game, it would be that it is too short. You can complete it in a day.In conclusion: if you are looking for an uncomplicated and fun fps, this is it! It feels like Star Wars, and that is important to me.

												Very good singleplayer campaign, although it's a bit short.  The epilogue leavs plenty of room for a sequel. The combat is great, and takes more than just shooting everything; it takes a nice amount of strategy and planning in order to succeed. However, my only complaint with the game is that it has yet to get a sequel. A sequel would be fantastic for this game, considering the new improvements in game engines since this game was created. Maybe the sequel will get up to my 1920x1080 screen resolution...

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 1, 2016
												Long Story short: Yes, I do recommend this game.Why? Read.Short introduction:Star Wars Republic Commando is a rather short FPS where you take the role of a clone Commando-Squad, the "Delta-Squad", consisting of four Elite clonetroopers: Boss, the squad leader (which you control), Fixer, the heavy arms guy, Scorch, the guy with the "l33t hax0r skillz" (actual quote), and Sev, the Sniper. In the course of the game these four troopers have to fulfill various objectives, such as stopping the Separatists from extracting from Geonosis.Story:As much as I'd like to tell you otherwise: The Story is rather irrelevant. It does help to know the sorroundings just a little, but in the overall game it is irrelevant. That's mostly because the sorroundings have either no effect on the Gameplay or are explained to you when relevant.Sound:I'll quote Wikipedia on this one: "Republic Commando features a darker and more militaristic soundtrack " than the rest of Star Wars. What this means is: You can hear that it's Star Wars, it's just adapted to the setting of the game.Regarding the overall sound: The weapons sound authentic, not that it would be hard to make a blaster sound like a blaster, especially heavier weaons, for example the cannons of Republic Assault Ships. Futhermore background noises exist, e.g. the battle on Geonosis and the Fauna on Kashyyyk. Also: The enemies sound like enemies and not just random AI. Why? The Super-Battledroids complain about being hit and some enemy classes keep on complaining about their weapons always being empty. So: breddy gud.Gameplay:Oh boy. Now comes the interesting part.As mentioned before, you control Boss, the squad leader. This means that you can/have to order your squad to do certain things, such as taking position to use a Sniper or planting explosives, so that you can advance to your objective. All this while being overwhelmed by enemy forces, who obviously try to stop you.There are several points to make, though:1. Your squadmates are absolutely loyal. Tell them to revive you while under enemy fire; they'll come to help you, complaining about "recommended protocols". Tell them to plant a bomb amidst four to five Super-Battledroids, they'll do, even if they die trying. What does this mean? The AI may not be dumb, but it certainly does not improvise.2. You are always overwhelmed and under pressure. Just like a true SpecOps team.3. No medkits. You can only regenerate health at Bacta-tanks, which are rather rare. You do have a weak energy-shield which stops you from taking damage directly for a few hits, though.4. You are always in dire need of ammo (atleast if you waste as much ammo is I do). Although you can pickup some enemy weapons, you can only pickup one at a time, and that weapon may not be that helpful (e. g. Wookie rocket launcher).Multiplayer: I'll skip this one, as it requires a workaround, because GameSpy is dead.Conclusion: This game is pretty fun, if you can survive a little anger, although I'd recommend buying it on sale, as it it took me only ~3 days-ish to complete.

content:
Posted: March 15
												If I had to choose only one Star Wars game to play out of the many out there, this is the one. This game is absolutely amazing. Great squad mechanics, awesome storyline, amazing characters, phenomenal gameplay, everything about this game is the real deal. Playing as a clone commando on the front lines in the clone wars brings a new and fantastic perspective to the Star Wars universe. 10/10 rating. Have played this game's campaign three times and every time I love it more and more.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 9, 2015
												This is a very fun game. I enjoyed a lot of it. This is a game certainly not for those who get frustrated easily. This game is suprisingly difficult game, even on easy. There needs to be a sequel.Pros-Great graphics for its time, its still decent now.-Great military feel with a good sense of realism due to its practical sound effects and actual military procedures.-Enjoyable squad based gameplay.-More gritty idea of Star Wars. The perspective of the clones gives this game a new perspective of the clone wars-It isn't focused on the star wars "heroes" such as Luke Skywalker. It is a nice expansion.-Awesome music.Cons-No multiplayer. If you can get on a sever, which is possible, there is probably no-one there.-Your squad is AI. It is an old game, so it can be forgiven for occasional annoying glitches.-Short campaign.-Cliff hangar ending.

content:
Posted: October 2, 2015
												Definitely a fun game, and I'm surprised there's not a sequel for it.  With any luck at all, they'll make one eventually.  I really liked the squad play, as well as the story, short as it was.  The extra commentary from the squad members was awesome, even hilarious at times.I'd really like to give this another playthrough eventually.  There are a couple things that I didn't like about the game, such as blaster rifle accuracy (I swear, I was almost as bad as the stormtroopers in the movies at times lol) and squad AI, but I'm betting those things are more my own fault than anything.  Giving the right orders to the squad for each situation was tricky at times, for me at least, and they died a lot lol.  I certainly think this game would have been far more fun with online multiplayer, if only that functionality was still available in the game.Regardless, it's a fun game either way, and playing single player adds a whole other level of challenge to it.  So if you're a Star Wars and FPS fan, then give this game a try, for sure.  7/10

Posted: October 2, 2015
												10/10 Must have for your collection and a must buy if you even are a star wars fan.Do not be fooled by the bad looking screenshots that look meh. The Game is one of the best star wars games out there and lets hope the new battlefront fails so that way they might look at reopening this can of awsomeness. Its well written the Ai for your Team is great.  Great storytelling and making you feel for your fellow clones. Great combat and overall gameplay. Only issues I have are the batttledroids wished they looked more like the movies and that the trandoshins looked like normal, cause Im a huge trandoshin fanboy.Semi SpoilersThough I wont put any heavy spoilers there are no books or anything on wookiepieda that will answer the main question of the ending the main reason is that the main writers or something want to have a story open in case they ever want to come back to delta squad.  Though There are books and such that talk about what happens to delta squad during the days of the empire and such.I recomend to check them out but they dont answer the huge question that we all want answered. Sadly its only fan theroies on what happend nothing solid.
